Astral Ring.title: Astral Ring System
Astral Ring.rawContent:
## Astral Ring System All valkyries from version 7.3 onwards are called Part 2 valkyries. They use a new Astral Ring (AR) system. This completely changes the valk mechanics and teambuilding. ## Astral Ring Specializations A Part 2 valkyrie will have ONE Astral Ring Specialization. There are 12 different AR Specializations in total.
Each Specialization has its own unique gameplay mechanic. Here's a summary of each one: - **World Star (WS):** Can create Resonance Marks. Certain attacks will trigger these Resonance Marks to deal damage. - **Wheel of Destiny (WOD): ** Centered around solo playstyle. Teammates become shadow atk during Stellar Outburst. - **Law of Ascension (LoA):** QTE switch playstyle. - **Rite of Oblivion (RoO):** Every RoO DPS has her own unique playstyle. ### Astral Ring Activation When a Part 2 valkyrie is set as leader, it will activate her AR Specialization. ## Astral Ring Attribute Each Astral Ring Specialization has a connected **Astral Ring Attribute** (also called AR tag). You can see this in valk filter menu, or by clicking the AR icons in valk menu.
A Part 2 character can only have one AR Specialization, but she can have multiple AR tags .
--- ### What AR Tags are used for AR tags determine two things: 1. A valk can support the DPS with the matching AR Specialization and activate the AR's unique mechanics. 2. AR tag is used to activate buffs or allow certain buffs to reach max effects. These include buffs from character skills, weapon, stigma, Astral Ops, and Abyss weather.
--- ### Rite of Oblivion The only exception to these rules is Rite of Oblivion (RoO). 1. RoO characters have buffs that do not require specific AR activation, so in theory, they can support any AR... right? 2. However, **without the matching AR tag, they can't activate certain important mechanics or unique buffs for that AR.** This means, RoO valks are just below average support options for teams without the matching AR tag. 3. Other AR specializations' leader skills require three members with specific AR tags to activate buffs. Rite of Oblivion characters count as a valid member **even without the required AR tag.** Here is an example with Coralie. Coralie is a RoO character with Domain Resonance tag.
## Terminology Some terms used by the AR system. ### Stellar Outburst All Part 2 valkyries can enter an enhanced state called Stellar Outburst (SO). You can activate SO when you have enough AR Intensity meter.
### Other Common Terms You will see these terms a lot in Part 2 buffs (character, equipment, AstralOp, Abyss weather) - **Astral Ring Charging**: When AR is activated, but you are not in Stellar Outburst mode. - **Stellar Outburst**: When AR is activated, and you are in Stellar Outburst mode. - **Augmented Ascension**: A special state only for Law of Ascension characters. During this state, you are considered to be in Stellar Outburst mode. ### Stellar Drain All Part 2 characters have Stellar Drain. Basically, you do Combo ATK / certain skill, you gain a good amount of AR Intensity (usually 20). - Can only trigger once per AR Charging state. - Stellar Drain refreshes after a Stellar Outburst ends.

Astral Ring.title: Part 2 Teambuilding
Astral Ring.rawContent:
## Part 1 Teambuilding 1. In Part 1, teams are built based on elements. 2. Valkyries, equipment and ELFs usually provide buffs for one specific element + some Total DMG buff. 3. Most valks are either a DPS or a Support. Some supports can also be a dps, but not the best dps, just decent. There's an exception to this - In Part 1.5, we got Lunar Vow and Herrscher of Rebirth, who are actually good at both DPS and support. 4. A valkyrie usually only has ONE best team lineup, consisting of DPS + S-rank Support + SP Support. 5. For equipment, most of the time equipment are gacha-only. There are farmable options (G3 or G4 Stigma from Foundry), but these take a few months to forge. ## Part 2 Teambuilding 1. In Part 2, teams are built based on ASTRAL RING Specializations. 2. Valkyries, equipment and Astral Ops provide buffs for ALL elements, but most of the buffs are restricted to specific AR types. 3. All S-ranks can be a DPS and a support, based on the position in the lineup. Example:
4. There are MULTIPLE OPTIMAL TEAM LINEUPS. You are not just restricted to only two specific supports now. Every support has her own unique abilities. For example: - For Wheel of Destiny teams, Senadina can provide powerful buffs like Elemental Breach while staying off-field the entire battle. - For Wheel of Destiny teams, Thelema provides shieldbreak, huge freeze trauma and evasion spam ar regen. - For World Star teams, Herrscher of Finality provides super quick resonance trigger.
But of course, Honkai Impact is complex. Not all Astral Ring teams have multiple lineups. There are some teams that still only have one best lineup. - **Herrscher of Finality DPS**: Needs Herrscher of Truth and Herrscher of Origin. - **Vita Lone Planetfarer DPS**: Needs team members with Astral Ring: Rite of Oblivion (RoO) to activate buffs like Elemental Breach, buffs and stronger Ult. Right now, there are only two RoO valks besides Vita - Herrscher of Finality and Coralie. --- 5. For equipment, you only need to gacha for weapon, 60 pulls guarantee max. Stigma is forgeable. You also get a lot of stigma if you pull weapon from gacha. In addition, when a new valkyrie debuts, you will get one stigma selector box.

Astral Ring.title: Planning Your Pulls as a F2P / Monthly Pass Players
Astral Ring.rawContent:
## Video Version This page has a [video version available here.](https://youtu.be/PIgVRcIyY4w) ## Introduction Since HI3 started having 9-weeks patch, whenever someone asked [Should I pull this new valk], I will give this answer: Due to how meta works (all valks are kinda balanced on release and have their own niche) and how patches are longer (Monthly players can get new S-rank fullgear every patch, and f2p can get new S-rank fullgear every one or two patches), itâ€™s better to: 1. Save until you can guarantee valk + full gear. 2. Then, get the latest valk early in the patch. This page will elaborate on the statement above. ## Longer Patches Patches are longer now, that means more crystal for every S-rank release!
F2P can get S-rank valk fullgear every one or two patches (one if you're lucky) Monthly / Monthly + BP players, you can get new S-rank every patch now (assuming average luck). You will only have issue deciding what to pull when a patch has extra stuff like Divine Key or AstralOp. ## All Part 2 Valks are balanced and have their own niche You might have heard I mention these in some character guides: - "Badum is a typical Part 2 valk" - "PS is a typical Part 2 valk" What a typical Part 2 valk means: 1. The valk top scores her bosses, decent dps everywhere else. 2. Can support multiple valks, but she is only the best support for certain valks. 3. Provides unique utilities that makes her the best DPS or support for certain bosses. --- ### Multiple optimal supports This infographic below shows what you how nice it is that there are so many support options now, and every valk has her own niche. On the other hand, it's also kinda disgusting how if you don't have the valk to counter a specific mechanic, some bosses just become unbearable.
--- ### The Best Supports Keep Changing A valk's best team changes based on the boss. Let's take [Ba-dum!](/valk/badum) as example. Most of the time Badum's best teammates are Vita, Sparkle and JD.
Then, comes a boss with huge shield hp. Now Badum's optimal teammate is Reign Solaris since she provides shieldbreak.
Then, boom! Mihoyo adds random blob with bleed trauma just to force the new valk Peregrine Sword to be Badum's teammate.
That's the first case. Next case: Teambuilding powercreep. Let's say you're a F2P, and you pulled Reign Solaris in v8.0, but you figured out Sparkle is one of the best teammates for her. "OK I'll pull Sparkle next patch then"
Then v8.1 comes: "Oh Badum is good for RS too, and Badum herself is great for new bosses. Ok, skip Sparkle then."
Then v8.2 comes: "What, RS best teammate is Peregrine Sword now? And new Helia also uses PS. All valks are good.... but I have no crystal to get every valk because Im F2P"
--- ### Some valks are 'better than typical'
"Vita is more special than other valks." I know there are some valks that are 'better than typical' like Vita. That is true, Vita is the most flexible support in the last few patches (but she's still not the best everywhere, especially at S0-rank). If you got her on debut, then congrats. But if you were thinking to get Vita on rerun, then the problem remains the same- ** CRYSTALS **. You don't have crystals. If you're a monthly player/whaler, who can afford new valk + Vita, then yeah, it was worth it to get Vita on her rerun. But for a F2P player who can only afford one S-rank valk every one or two patches, was it worth it skipping new valk to pull Vita rerun? **ABSOLUTELY NOT.** --- ### Uncertainty of a valk's future value Characters also have locked skills for future AR, which can hide their true value until their locked skill is revealed.
Take [Sparkle](/valk/sparkle) for example. During her release, Sparkle looked really underwhelming in World Star teams. She was good in P1 Fire but that didn't matter much when AR is the new craze. Then, Law of Ascension was revealed. Turns out Sparkle has one of the best kits for that AR.
> And of course, valks with new Astral Ring should be a higher priority to pull, right? > So F2P should just skip the valk in the current patch to guarantee this new valk with new AR next patch, right? Well turns out the best support for that valk with new AR is the valk from previous patch (Sparkle for RS, PS for Helia). Now your shiny new AR is not at its full potential.
## Get the new valk early in the patch The reason you want to get a valk early in the patch is to get the most value out of her DPS role. For most valkyries, their bosses appear during the first 3-4 weeks of the new patch. After that, their bosses will only appear once in a while, and the valk will be used more often as support (outside of Arena mode).
## Save until you can guarantee valk + full gear You really really want to get valk + weapon. Weapon has always been very important in HI3. There's usually important utilities locked behind weapon and there is no good alternative F2P options. For example, if you dont have Reign Solaris' weapon, her attacks won't have the img dmg transfer mechanic, on top of the usual dmg loss.
With signature weapon, Planar Armament gain 10% more initial sp during SO. This seems like an important utility considering she consumes a lot of sp during SO.
For support role, all P2 weapons now have this independent multiplier. Unless you have another compatible P2 weapon, the dmg loss from not having this independent multiplier is big enough that you would be better off using another support with full gear (unless the boss requires a specific utility that the valk can provide).
## New Valk is Cheaper New valkyries usually come with 50% off for the first ten pulls of Battlesuit Supply. ## END That's it for this page. Hopefully, this page has laid out all the factors that lead us to the conclusion for this pull recommendation: Due to how meta works (all valks are kinda balanced on release and have their own niche) and how patches are longer (Monthly players can get new S-rank fullgear every patch, and f2p can get new S-rank fullgear every one or two patches), itâ€™s better to: 1. Save until you can guarantee valk + full gear. 2. Then, get the latest valk early in the patch.

Shop.title: Battle Pass
Shop.rawContent:
## Introduction to Battle Pass HI3 Battle Pass rewards are very different from Honkai Star Rail and Genshin Impact. The biggest differences are: 1. You earn a currency called Immutable Crystallum which can be used to purchase past S-rank characters and equipment released 3+ years ago. 2. If you purchase the paid tier, you'll receive additional Crystallum and gain access to more recent S-rank characters and equipment from the past 1â€“2 years.
--- ## BP Tiers There are three tiers - Vanguard (Free), Knight (~10 USD), and Paladin (~20 USD).
### Crystallum Income Per Patch - Vanguard: 5 - Knight: 18 - Paladin: 24 ### Some notable rewards for the paid tier - Knight / Paladin BP unlocks the ability to purchase S-rank character and equipment from 1-2 years ago. - Knight / Paladin BP gives fragments for the featured S-rank. Knight 10 frags, Paladin 10+20 = 30 frags. - Paladin BP gives Wafer Stabilizer and Dataflow, used to fine-tune stigma affix stats. This is useful for competitive players. - Cosmetic: Knight BP gives an outfit / outfit box, Paladin BP gives a ribbon. --- ## BP Works Shop BP Works Shop has S-rank characters from the last 1-2 years, and the content of the shop can only be purchased if you buy Knight or Paladin Pass. ![BP Equipment](https://i.imgur.com/Z84WA7B.png) ### How the shop works - In each version, BP Works adds a set of S-rank character and her equipment. - Every set lasts for 3 versions. - The shop has 3 sets: set from current patch and previous two patches. Since the shop is new, v8.2 will only have the v8.2 S-rank set. - Purchasing Knight or Paladin BP will allow you to purchase all 3 sets that are available in that version. In the next version, if you don't buy Knight or Paladin BP, you cannot purchase the content of the new set added in that version, but you can still purchase the set from the previous 2 versions. If you don't get how it works, here's a visual example:
### Should You Get Senadina / Whatever Character in There? If you can afford it, yeah definitely. Since Part 2 characters all have their niche as both dps and support, then it is worth getting Senadina + weapon, or whatever character is going to be in the shop. >I can only afford one S-rank + weapon out of the three, which one should I get? Refer to [each valk guide page](/valk) for more info. But general answer for most cases: Get Part 2 valk first. If all the sets are for Part 2 valk, then get the latest valk. --- ## Reserve Works Shop Reserve Works Shop has all S-rank characters and most equipment from over 3 years ago. Currently, the content of the shop is up until Herrscher of Human patch (v6.0) . The developers have stated that this shop will be updated gradually over time. ![BP Equipment](https://i.imgur.com/QfzNLWO.png)
### Best Item to Get #### 1. BP Works Item Reminder: Items in Reserve Works uses **the same currency** as BP Works Shop. It is always better to purchase item in BP Works since they are newer. --- #### 2. Divine Keys
Divine Keys give global +10 ATK for all characters. When these stack up, they can give a significant damage increase, equal to having a second weapon on your valk. However, do note that some Divine Keys have been given for free in the past, and may be available in major spending event (happens twice a year). Only get the Divine Keys above from BP if you can't wait that long. --- #### 3. Meta Character
Herrscher of Human (HoH) is the only meta character in the shop. If you have not maxed her ranks yet, then you can consider getting her stamps from this shop. **Regarding buying HoH battlesuit for F2P**
For F2P, 24 Crystallum cost is VERY EXPENSIVE. It is equal to 5 patches worth of Crystallum, that is almost a year worth! **For new players that can afford it**
HoH battlesuit is available in starter B-chip pack. Save your Crystallum and get HoH from the pack instead. **Note**
Only get the stamps, don't get her equipment. She uses a different set for Part 2. [Please go to Herrscher of Human guide page to learn more.](/valk/hoh) --- #### 4. Save Everything else in the Reserve Works shop is outdated. Save your crystallum for BP Works Shop item, or wait for a better item that might get added to the Reserve Works shop in the future.

Shop.title: Foundry
Shop.rawContent:
This is where you forge equipment and stigma. A lot of the equipment here are very old and outdated Part 1 equipment. So I will only talk about some notable ones. ## Note on Resources After starter event ends, you will only get limited forge resources per week. It will take weeks, and months to forge a stigma. So don't waste them forging everything. ## Prism Stigma Prism Stigma are stigma used by Part 2 Valkyries. All Part 2 stigma are forgeable, and they all have the same cost. ![](https://i.imgur.com/6qQIVW9.png) ## Part 1 Stigma These are stigma used by Part 1 valks. ### G3 Stigma
Turgenev TB

Turgenev is a universal Elemental support stigma that can be used by any support. It is still used by Golden Diva in certain cases, and still used by a lot of valks in Memorial Arena mode.

If you have Tsiolkovsky stigma (Coralie's stigma), you can also use that for any support instead of forging Turgenev.

### G4 Stigma
Little Joys Set

Best For: Miracle Magical Girl

Best For: Dea Anchora if Sparkle support is in the team, or for Elysian Realm

Best farmable option for Part 1 Fire DPS

Handel Set

Best For: Golden Diva, but sometimes she uses Turgenev TB

Best For: Herrscher of Thunder

Great farmable option for Part 1 Lightning DPS

Willows Set

Best For: Herrscher of Reason

Best farmable option for Herrscher of Human and Silverwing N-EX

Best For: Other Part 1 Ice DPS

Paganini M

Gives Shield DMG buff, can be used by any support against enemies with tanky shields.

## Divine Keys These weapons can be tuned in Divine Key Concierge to grant global buffs.
Pledge of Sakura

Unlocking and upgrading Pledge of Sakura grants global ATK and CRT boost, and unlocks the Lightning DMG and sp regen gene limit.

Abyss

If you have Abyss Flower Divine Key, you can tune both Abyss and Abyss Flower to gain global +10 ATK.

Without Abyss Flower, tuning Abyss only grants global +20 HP.

Fenghuang Pinions

If you have Fenghuang Down or Brick Divine Key, you can tune the weapons to gain global +10 ATK, each.

Without Fenghuang Down or Brick, tuning Fenghuang Pinions only grants global +20 HP.

## Weapon Resonance Fodder
There are some useful weapons in Exchange Shop, and you can purchase them using Weapon Resonance. Weapon Resonance used to be a common currency in Part 1 - you can get Weapon Resonance by converting Part 1 gacha weapons, and you can easily get weapons from Part 1 gacha. This is not the case anymore, since Part 2 supplies do not give Part 1 gacha weapons. So, how do you get Weapon Resonance now? You can forge 'Bounty Weapons' in Foundry, and convert them to Weapon Resonance. Out of all the Bounty Weapons, 3rd Sacred Relic has the lowest Honkai Piece cost.

Shop.title: Asterite Shop
Shop.rawContent:
Asterite Shop is where you can purchase A-rank fragments and higher-tier upgrade materials using Asterite currency. ## Part 2 Valkyries ![Coralie and Helia](https://i.imgur.com/k61cYbh.jpeg) - [Coralie](/valk/coralie) can be used as a support in any Astral Ring team until you get a proper S-rank support. - [Helia](/valk/helia) is a f2p support for World Star team. Her buffs are centered around weapon skill, so she's more effective for Senadina than Schicksal's Imperative and Sparkle. - Their synergy weapon upgrade materials are very expensive. You should finish ranking up Coralie and Helia first (and whatever other character that you want), then you can purchase the material later. ## Part 1 Valkyries Most Part 1 characters are already obselete. Some of them are still useful for new players, but there's no urgency to farm them, as their impact on your account late game is not that big. ### Elysian Realm These characters are available in Elysian Realm mode. - You can get 620 crystals from first-clear mission, PER VALK. - You only need to unlock them at A-rank for Elysian Realm. - Unlocking and ranking them up also improves your Dorm Level EXP, which grants you global ATK and buffs - and it helps you fulfill S+ rank Dorm Errand requirements. #### A-rank Valkyries ![Characters in Elysian Realm](https://i.imgur.com/RdlOVa8.jpeg) #### Augment Core Selector For Augment Core selector, these are the augment valks that are available in Elysian Realm.
- You need the base valkyries + augment cores to unlock them in Elysian Realm, so it will take longer to get compared to the A-rank valks above. - Not recommended to purchase these all at once since it can get costly. You can get the core slowly over time from Open World, then purchase the remaining cores required to unlock the next augment upgrade. ## Asterite Currency You can get Asterite currency naturally by doing dailies, weeklies, events, Dorm Shop, Battle Pass, supplies and more (Just click the currency icon, then press GET, it will show you all the source for Asterite). There is one feature to get Asterite that might be easily missed / forgotten by new players. As you complete missions, you gain Energy. And you can use energy to convert excess materials into Asterites. Check this once a week. However, as a new player, you might not have enough materials to do this exchange. It is fine to let it stay maxed out. ![ast 1](https://i.imgur.com/H04wmVA.jpeg) ![ast 2](https://i.imgur.com/kW8RNO1.jpeg) ![ast 3](https://i.imgur.com/BHGSQRN.jpeg) ![ast 4](https://i.imgur.com/OUPA0A1.jpeg)

Shop.title: War Treasury Shop
Shop.rawContent:
War Treasury is one of the earliest shops in Honkai Impact. Back then, it was the best shop in the game, because you can get characters like Knight Moonbeam and Lightning Empress, which actually improved your account. You could even get a gacha weapon back then. Now, War Treasury shop is just a retirement home for Part 1 valks. ## Ancient Willpower and Ancient Legacy
**Ancient Willpower (AW)** and **Ancient Legacy (AL)** are the currencies used in War Treasury shop. The main source of AW and AL is from Memorial Arena mode. You can get them from other sources such as Abyss mode, Battle Pass and events. You get significantly more AL in Exalted tier (Lv81+) of Memorial Arena and Abyss modes. ## First Valkyries to Unlock I personally recommend unlocking these S-ranks first. Just keep in mind they will not be a big improvement for your account even when fully geared since the meta right now is all about Part 2. They are just the better choice to spend your materials on compared to the rest of the shop.
### Miracle Magical Girl - MECH Fire Ignite DPS. - The last S-rank farmable from War Treasury from debut patch. - She is still the only Ignite DPS in the game right now. She still top scores some Ignite weather bosses (although they rarely appear now). ### Herrscher of Sentience - Part 1 Physical Support and DPS. - Backbone support for Part 1 Physical teams, until you get Herrscher of Rebirth. ## Elysian Realm These characters are available in Elysian Realm mode. You can get 620 crystals from first-clear mission, PER VALK. Unlocking and ranking them up also improves your Dorm Level EXP, and helps you fulfill S+ rank Dorm Errand requirements. ![wt er valks](https://i.imgur.com/oy3BRBV.jpeg) ## Other Materials ### Wafer Stabilizer and Dataflow
These are materials used for late-game ATK affix min-maxing. For new players, not worth buying these over unlocking S-rank characters for Elysian Realm first-clear crystals and dorm buffs. --- ### Ancient Willpower
As a new player, your Asterite income is very limited, it's better used to purchase A-rank character fragments like [Coralie](/valk/coralie) or [Pardofelis](/valk/pardo) first for Elysian Realm first-clear crystals and dorm buffs.

Shop.title: Exchange Shop
Shop.rawContent:
## Exchange Shop Exchange Shop has old Part 1 equipment that can be exchanged using Weapon Resonance and Stigma Resonance.
--- ## How to Get Resonance ### Weapon Resonance Weapon Resonance used to be a common currency in Part 1 - you can get Weapon Resonance by converting Part 1 gacha weapons, and you can easily get weapons from Part 1 gacha. This is not the case anymore, since Part 2 supplies do not give Part 1 gacha weapons. So, how do you get Weapon Resonance now? You can forge 'Bounty Weapons' in Foundry, and convert them to Weapon Resonance. Out of all the Bounty Weapons, 3rd Sacred Relic has the lowest Honkai Piece cost.
### Stigma Resonance You get Stigma Resonance weekly from Open World. As a new player, you also get an abundance of them from starter event, but once that is over, you will only get a limited amount every week, so don't waste them. --- ## Weapon ### Oath of Judah Oath of Judah is a Divine Key weapon - it can be tuned in Divine Key Concierge to grant global ATK and Lightning DMG buff. If you already have Salvation of Sakura tuned in, Oath of Judah can still give global +10 ATK.
--- ## Stigma Stigma in this category are still used by Part 1 valkyries, mostly in Memorial Arena mode. ### Turgenev TB Turgenev TB is a universal Elemental support stigma that can be used by any support. It is still used by Golden Diva in certain cases, and still used by a lot of valks in Memorial Arena mode.
### Mei Beach M and Newton B These two stigma are stigmas that apply short but powerful debuff. They are commonly used for SS-rank Arena bosses. Veteran players have multiple copies of these stigma.
### Tesla Band TM - Tesla Band T: Physical Support, sometimes used in Arena. - Tesla Band M: Lightning Support, sometimes used in Arena.
### Jin Shengtan TM Jin Shengtan (JST) TM is a universal Elemental support stigma, like a weaker version of Turgenev TB, but - JST and Turgenev are commonly paired together on the two supports in Arena.
### Schrodinger M Schrodinger M can reduce Ult cd. Herrscher of Origin sometimes use Schrodinger M in Arena - and very situationally in Abyss.
--- ## Forge Materials Stigma in this category are just decent, but they are used to forge G4 stigma, which are the best stigma for certain Part 1 valkyries, and general second best options for other Part 1 valkyries. ### Goemon Material for G4 Handel set, which is used by Herrscher of Thunder, Golden Diva, and a great option for other Part 1 Lightning DPS.
### Leeuwenhoek Material for G4 Little Joys set, which is used by Sirin, Dea Anchora, and a great option for other Part 1 Fire DPS.
--- ## Others Equipment in this category are the signature set for outdated Part 1 valkyries. There's no urgency to get these. Please read the valk's guide page to learn more about the valk before you decide to spend your resources on these equipment.

Midnight Absinthe Equipment

Miss Pink Elf Equipment.

Herrscher of Flamescion Equipment

Fischl Equipment. Zhenyi can be used by other Part 1 Lightning DPS.

Starchasm Nyx Equipment

Herrscher of Sentience Old Equipment

Bright Knight Equipment

Twilight Paladin Equipment

Azure Empyrea Equipment

Stygian Nymph Equipment

Others.title: Part 1 Gacha
Others.rawContent:
Just some info on old supplies (Incomplete).

### Expansion Supply
Before v7.3, Battlesuit Supply is known as Expansion Supply, and has some differences:
- Featured S-rank is guaranteed within 100 pulls / 28,000 crystals
- Featured A-rank drop rate is lower

---

### ADV Supply
A valkyrie supply that allows you to immediately get SS-rank if you hit 100 pulls milestone. This is only available for valkyries that are over 8 patches old.
- Every 10 pulls give you a stamp (10 fragments). S-rank card is guaranteed within 100 pulls.
- S-rank drop rate is much lower than normal battlesuit supply.
- A-rank offrates include all A-ranks in the game (excluding SP valks).

---

### Focused Supply
Equipment Supply for Part 1
- Content: One featured weapon + stigma set (Top, Mid, Bottom), and a few off-rate weapon and stigma
- A new featured weapon / stigma is guaranteed within 50 pulls, max 200 pulls / 56,000 crystals for full set.
- Usually you don't hit the max pity. Around 120-150 pulls average for full set.
- In Part 1 Focused Supply, you get more weapons than stigma. In Part 2 Equipment Supply, you get more stigma than weapon.

---

### SP Battlesuit Supply (Removed)
A cheaper battlesuit supply, where you can get the featured SP valkyrie.

---

### SP Focused Supply (Removed)
This supply is only available on the debut patch of an SP valkyrie.
- Content: One featured weapon + stigma set (Top, Mid, Bottom) of the new SP valkyrie, and a few off-rate weapon and stigma
- Cost: 280 crystal per pull, or one Equipment Supply Card
- A new featured weapon / stigma is guaranteed within 30 pulls, max 90 pulls / 25,200 crystals for full set. Usually you don't hit the max pity. 
- In Part 1 Focused Supply, you get more weapons than stigma. In Part 2 Equipment Supply, you get more stigma than weapon.

---

### EXPA SELECT (Removed)
Event version of Expansion Supply that appears during spending event.
- Content: There are three featured S-ranks. They share S-rank 100 pull guarantee. 
- You can choose the featured S-rank, and you can change the featured S-rank at any time (there is a limit).
- Usually we have three EXPA Select sets (9 S-ranks) that are alternating every 3-4 days for two weeks.

---

### FOCA SELECT (Removed)
Event version of Focused Supply that appears during spending event.
- Content: There are five featured weapons and stigma sets. They share weapon 60 pull guarantee.
- You can choose the featured weapon and stigma set. The other four sets become the off-rates. You can switch the featured set at any time (there is a limit). 
- Usually we have three FOCA Select sets (15 equipment set) that are alternating every 3-4 days for two weeks.

---

### Part 1 Divine Key Supply (Removed)
This is where you can pull Divine Key weapons. Divine Keys are a special type of weapons. 
- Gacha divine keys give global +10 ATK to all characters.
- Modern divine keys are like DLC that bring back old valkyries to meta.

---

### Schicksal Arsenal (Removed)
Schicksal Arsenal is a type of Focused Supply with boosted 4-star equipment drop rate. There are two featured weapons and 1 featured stigma. Usually one of the featured weapon is a divine key, and the other featured weapon + stigma set is for an SP valkyrie.
- Cost: 280 crystal per pull
- Guarantees one of the featured weapon in 50 pulls

---

### Firepower Supply (Removed)
There will be a list of equipment. You can select a number of weapons + stigma sets to become the content of Firepower Supply.
- Cost: 2,800 crystal
- You can only do one ten-pull
- You are guaranteed to get an equipment that you have not unlocked yet.

Others.title: Battle Pass (Before v8.2)
Others.rawContent:
## Introduction to Battle Pass (Before v8.2) This is an archive for BP page before the v8.2 rework. HI3 Battle Pass rewards are very different from Honkai Star Rail and Genshin Impact. The biggest differences are:
  1. You get a currency called Crystallum which you can use to buy past gacha equipment.
  2. If you get the paid tier, you can use the Crystallum to get past S-rank character and S-rank ELF .
  3. Battle Pass refreshes every patch, but it uses an extra Season system. Each season lasts for four patches. More details below.
--- ## BP Tiers There are three tiers - Vanguard (Free), Knight (Paid), and Paladin (More Expensive).
Some notable rewards for the paid tier: - Knight BP gives 9 more Crystallums balls. This tier gives the most balls. - Knight / Paladin BP unlocks the ability to purchase S-rank character and ELF card / fragments. - Paladin BP gives 15 more fragments for the featured S-rank, and a lot of Wafer Stabilizer, used to fine-tune your stigma affix stats (this is useful for competitive players). --- ## BP Season A BP Season lasts for four patches. (Actual in-game term is BP Theme) ### Crystallum Crystallum is the currency used to purchase items in BP Works shop. Each season uses a different crystallum.
#### Crystallum Income Per Patch - Vanguard: 5 - Knight: 14 - Paladin: 16 --- ## Featured Valkyrie During a BP season, there are two featured valkyries for the BP Level rewards and BP Shop. ### BP Level - The first valk is available for the first and second patch. - The second valk is available for the third and fourth patch.
### BP Shop - The first valk card/stamps are added on the first and second patch. They remain in the shop until BP season ends. - The second valk card/stamps are added on the third and fourth patch. They remain in the shop until BP season ends.
--- ## Equipment ### BP Works Shop A new set of equipment is added BP Works shop every patch. The equipment remain in the shop until BP season ends + one more patch. ![BP Equipment](https://i.imgur.com/zWuLuV0.jpeg) --- ### Vintage Shop After the BP season ends, the equipment will remain for one more patch in a separate shop called BP Works Vintage. This is your last chance to purchase the equipment. - In Vintage shop, you can convert the new crystallum to the previous crystallum, in case you are short a few crystallum to get an equipment. - "What? You can use old crystallum to get the new crystallum?!" NO! ðŸ˜  New convert to old! Not old convert to new! ðŸ˜  Image below shows the vintage shop in v7.8. These are equipment from v7.4-7.7 Battle Pass. When 7.8 Battle Pass ends, the old Crystallum will expire to 15 Torus each. ![BP Vintage](https://i.imgur.com/LR6rRlp.jpeg) --- ## BP Arsenal This shop resets every patch and uses a material called Honor Chips, which also resets every patch (specifically, on Monday of the patch week). Remember to use these before they expire! ![BP Vintage](https://i.imgur.com/yAaEllX.png)

Getting Started.title: Read This First
Getting Started.rawContent:
I ain't reading all that.

I don't expect you to read all the articles here. So here are some quick important tips to prevent you from wasting important resources. ## Do Not Pull Starter Supply
Starter Supply is bad for a number of reasons: 1. Due to how the meta works, it is better to use your crystal to pull the newest valkyrie. As F2P, your crystal income is very limited, you can only get **ONE** S-rank fully-geared every one or two patches, so you don't want to waste your crystal on older valks. 2. Starter supply is only available for 90 days, and the guarantee counter is not shared with other supplies. Normal supplies are always available (in rotation) and the guarantee counter is shared with other normal supplies. 3. The character [Deepspace Anchor](/valk/sena) is available in Battle Pass version 8.2 - 8.4. If you can afford it, consider purchasing Battle Pass to get her instead of pulling her from this supply. ## Do Not Upgrade Everything
Honkai Impact is 8 years old, that means 8 YEARS WORTH OF OUTDATED CONTENT. You will get a lot of characters and equipment from starter event, Dorm Supplies, shops, etc. Don't spend your resources on every single character or gear that you get. That is an easy way to go bankrupt on materials in early game. Use it only on the latest valkyries. ## Do Dailies and Events
This is where your dailies / weeklies / limited-time event missions are. ## The Best Starter Team None. All those free characters are old Part 1 valks or missing weapon and stigma. The best starter team is the first Part 2 S-rank that you pulled. Then, put [Coralie Valkyrie Blastmetal](/valk/coralie) as the support. It will be A LOT better than whatever you get from those starter events. ## There is No Broken Character There is no Castorice or Mavuika or Miyabi in Honkai Impact. 1. The most important end-game mode EX Abyss uses a 'Weather' system, which buffs certain damage types or characters (like Fire UP, Melee UP, Imaginary Type UP), and every patch adds new bosses with weird mechanics that favor the newest characters. These factors combined have ensured that no character can be the best at everything. Some DPS can bruteforce more bosses than others, but can never bruteforce everything. 2. You may have heard a famous online saying of "Pull support first because they last longer." Well, that quote is from Part 1. All Part 2 S-ranks are both DPS and Support. ### So, what do I pull with my crystal? Pull the latest S-rank. ## The Real Game Starts at Level 80+ Once you get to Level 80, you can breakthrough, increasing your max level, and unlocking an entirely new difficulty tier called **Exalted Tier** and a new end-game mode **Superstring Dimension**. Yes, it is harder, but manageable, and gives significantly more crystal income per week. It only takes around a month for a new account to get to Lv80.

Getting Started.title: Game Server
Getting Started.rawContent:
The battle starts before you even install the game.

## Introduction to HI3 Servers and Clients In Honkai Star Rail and Genshin Impact, there is only one game client, and you can change server within that client. This is not the case with Honkai Impact 3rd. In HI3, each server uses a seperate client. ## List of Servers In Hoyoplay Launcher (PC), there are six servers that you can choose. For mobile, only the default app for your region is displayed on Google Play and iOS App Store. - Europe (EU) & Americas (NA) (They share one client) - Japan (JP) - Korea (KR) - South-East Asia (SEA) - Traditional Chinese Server (equivalent to TW, HK, MO servers in Genshin/StarRail). Only SEA, EU and NA servers use English language. ![List of available HI3 servers in Hoyoplay](https://i.imgur.com/PEyX4D0.png) --- ## Server Differences for SEA, NA, EU ### App Name For mobile, SEA app name is Honkai Impact 3. EU / NA app name is Honkai Impact 3rd. ### Voice, UI Language and Reset Time | Server | Voice Over | UI Language | Server Time | | -------- | :-----: | -------- | ------- | | SEA | JP, CN | English , CN, Viet, Indo, Thai | UTC +8 | | Europe | JP, CN | English, CN, French, German | UTC +1 | | Americas | JP, CN | English, CN, French, German| UTC -5 | ### Touch Feature In SEA server, you can touch valkyries! This feature is only available for very old Part 1 valkyries.
### Anniversary Date Originally, the regional servers had different anniversary date. But starting from Part 2 (v7.3), our anniversaries are synced to around Feb/March (7.3 date is Feb 29, 2024). ### Server Population SEA server has significantly more players. It is unclear who has more players for NA and EU. **Online matchmaking:** HI3 has multiplayer events from time to time like Fall Guys, Chibi Lobby and HSR Collab card event. Matchmaking is faster in SEA server. I once tried EU server, and took a long time to get a match in Fall Guys event. **Competitive:** HI3's hardest mode is EX Abyss - it has ranking system and extra crystals and emblems for reaching Top 100 in every round. - Since there are more players, it's harder to get Top 50 in SEA server. - Top 100 score breakpoint is also much higher in SEA than NA / EU. - Nirvana group retention is easier in SEA than NA / EU because more players = more brackets = less chance to be in the same room with T100 players. - For Red Lotus group, EU server has lower Disturbance than other servers (enemies have less HP). ### Physical Merch Limitation From time to time, there are physical merch giveaways like Art Collection and raffle event. Physical merch is only shipped to certain countries tied to the server geographically. Below is an example of Art Collection Vol 2 shipping areas for SEA server.
--- ## So, which server should you play? By default, it's best to play the default server for your region. - For an easier chance at reaching Top 100, then consider EU or NA server. - If you're looking for faster matchmaking and more populated in-game lobbies, then play SEA server. - If getting physical merch matters to you, choose the default server for your region. --- ## More Server Trivia - The six servers (on Hoyoplay) are officially known as **Regional Servers**, indicating that these servers are different from the mainland China server - **CN Server.** CN server is ahead by around 4 weeks. This is why we EN players can plan ahead with our pulls. - EU and NA share a client. They are commonly referred to as Global (GLB) server. - For iOS and Android, the default server is based on your region. You can get apk files of other server clients from 3rd-party app stores. - Steam client uses EU / NA server, but it uses Steam ID and cannot connect to your Hoyoverse account. - **Traditional Chinese**: Not to be confused with the actual CN server. Traditional Chinese has the same update time as EN servers. This server is equivalent to TW, HK, MO servers in Genshin/StarRail. - **CN server:** CN server is ahead by around 4 weeks. This is why we EN players can plan ahead with our pulls. There are multiple CN servers (PC, iOS, Android, Oppo, Taptap, Bilibili and more) - **JP server** has higher drop rate, but does not have guarantee in supplies. I don't know if this is still the case after Part 2 update.

Getting Started.title: Materials and Terms Comparison with Star Rail
Getting Started.rawContent:
Here are some notable materials and terms to get you up to speed with the game.

![Material comparison with HSR](https://i.imgur.com/t3uKvUm.png)


![Material comparison with HSR 2](https://i.imgur.com/33Y3ymJ.png)

Getting Started.title: Gacha in HI3
Getting Started.rawContent:
## Part 2 Supplies In Part 2, the gacha has been simplified. All Part 2 content are available from these gacha: - Battlesuit Supply - Equipment Supply - AstralOp Supply --- ### Battlesuit Supply This is where you pull S-rank characters.
- Content: One featured S-rank, one featured A-rank, three other A-ranks. - Cost per pull: 280 crystal, or one Battlesuit Supply Card. - Every 10 pulls guarantee an A-rank or S-rank valk. - Featured S-rank is guaranteed within 90 pulls / 25,200 crystals. - Usually, there is a 50% discount for the first ten pulls for new S-rank. --- ### Equipment Supply This is where you pull the equipment.
- Content: One featured weapon + stigma set (Top, Mid, Bottom). - Cost per pull: 280 crystal, or one Equipment Supply Card. - Every 10 pulls guarantee weapon or one of the stigma pieces. - Featured weapon is guaranteed within 60 pulls / 16,800 crystals. --- ### AstralOp Supply This is where you pull AstralOp. What is AstralOp? Well it's basically like Bangboo, but what if the Bangboo is broken like Castorice? Yeah.
- Content: One featured S-rank AstralOp. - Cost per pull: 280 crystal, or one Equipment Supply Card. - Every 10 pulls guarantee AstralOp or some upgrade materials. - Featured AstralOp is guaranteed within 60 pulls / 16,800 crystals. --- ## Special Part 2 Supplies When a valkyrie is over 8 patches old, that valkyrie might be available in these special supplies: ### Ascension Supply A special version of Battlesuit Supply, where you can get a valk and instantly rank her up to SS-rank if you do 90 pulls.
- Cost per pull: 280 crystal, or one Ascension Supply Card. - Every 10 pulls guarantee an A-rank or S-rank valk. - Featured S-rank is guaranteed within 90 pulls / 25,200 crystals. - Pull until 90 pulls to get 10 stamps (100 fragments), enough to unlock a valk and her rank her up to SS-rank. - Guarantee counter for each Ascension Supply banner is not carried over to other Ascension Supply banner. --- ### Armament Ascension Supply A special version of Equipment Supply, where you can get up to 18 Equipment Supply cards. Basically, like a rebate.
- Cost per pull: 280 crystal, or one Equipment Supply Card. - Every 10 pulls guarantee weapon or one of the stigma pieces. - Featured weapon is guaranteed within 60 pulls / 16,800 crystals. - Every 10 pulls gives 3 Equipment Supply Cards, max 18 Equipment Supply cards can be obtained (at 60 pulls). - Guarantee counter for each Armament Ascension banner is not carried over to other Armament Ascension banner. --- ## Pull Valk + Weapon In Honkai Impact, weapon is very important. Most of the time, signature weapon has a very important utility that completes the valkyrie. There's no good farmable alternative for weapon like in Star Rail or Genshin Impact. Imagine if Imbibitor Lunae only has maximum 1 Lotus stack by default, and only gets 3 max Lotus stack if he has signature Light Cone. Well, that's basically what happens to Jovial Deception. She only has 3 meter stack by default, and only gets 6 meter stack with signature weapon. ![6 stack vs 3 stack](https://i.imgur.com/nITEGhN.png)

Game Mechanics.title: Type
Game Mechanics.rawContent:
## Character and Enemy Types There are currently 6 types in Honkai Impact. A character or enemy can only have one type. - Biologic (BIO) - Mechanical (MECH) - Psychic (PSY) - Quantum (QUA) - Imaginary (IMG) - Stardust (SD) - Enemies can also be typeless ## Type Counter Relationship
Image above shows the relationship between types. - Straight line means type advantage / effective against / strong against. - Dotted line means type disadvantage / not effective against / weak against. Examples: - PSY valks deal more damage against MECH enemies, but deal less damage against BIO enemies. - IMG valks deal more damage against IMG enemies, but deal less damage against QUA enemies. ## Type Counter Bonus When a valk attacks an enemy with type advantage, the valk deals 30% more damage. In Abyss mode, the bonus damage becomes even stronger in Type Counter weather: Type counter effect is 20% stronger. ## BIO, MECH, PSY BIO, MECH and PSY types are the first types in the game. These characters / enemies do not have any type-exclusive mechanic besides type counter bonus. ## Quantum ### QUA Enemies 1. QUA enemies have a QUA shield. When the shield is active, the QUA enemy takes reduced damage and have higher anti-interrupt. 2. A QUA enemy can have multiple stacks of QUA shields. ### QUA Characters 1. QUA characters have abilities that can immediately remove stack(s) of QUA shield. 2. Sparkle can insta-kill QUA enemies below 10% HP. ## Imaginary ### IMG Enemies 1. IMG enemies have two HP bars - shell hp and seed hp. 2. Your attacks will hit shell hp first. When shell hp bar is depleted, the seed will be exposed, and now you can attack the seed. 3. When seed is exposed, the shell will gradually restore HP. If seed HP is full, it will return to normal, and you have to attack the shell again. ### IMG Characters 1. Some IMG characters have abilities that can transfer a portion dmg dealt from the shell to the seed. 2. Some IMG characters can insta-kill IMG seed once it is below a certain HP treshold. ## Stardust ### SD Enemies 1. SD enemies utilize 'regular HP' bar and 'Max HP' bar. 2. SD enemies have critical points on their HP bar. When the HP bar reaches the critical point: - SD remnants will drop. Any valk can collect the SD remnants to deal big damage to the enemy. - They will enter Consolidated state. During this state, attacks will deal damage to Max HP bar. 3. After a certain duration, SD enemy will return to its normal state, and your attacks will deal damage to regular HP bar again. ### SD Characters 1. SD characters have abilities that can instantly gather SD remnants, and the remnant dmg is stronger. 2. Jovial Deception can instantly trigger critical point. 3. Ba-dum! can reduce 8% of Max HP bar.

Game Mechanics.title: Damage Element
Game Mechanics.rawContent:
## The Original Four Most damage in Honkai Impact belong to one of following damage: - Physical DMG - Lightning DMG - Ice DMG - Fire DMG

Each element has its own damage colour:

### More Info 1. All valkyries have one element, which can be seen in valkyrie menu. - Most modern valkyries only deal damage of their corresponding element. - Older valkyries may deal a different damage from their corresponding element. 2. Collectively, Lightning, Ice and Fire DMG are referred to as Elemental DMG. If a buff says it affects Elemental DMG, then it refers to Lightning, Ice and Fire DMG - not Physical DMG. 3. Unlike Honkai Star Rail and Genshin Impact, in HI3, Elemental DMG cannot crit. Only Physical DMG can crit. 4. Against enemies with type disadvantage, crit will have white number. You can still crit, it just won't show the yellow number. Why is this a thing? I don't know. --- ## Bleed and Ignite DMG In 2023, Bleed DMG and Ignite DMG were introduced. These are not new damage elements, rather, they are extra damage elements that exist alongside one of the four main damage elements. Characters with Bleed / Ignite DMG benefit from buffs that affect both their primary element and Bleed / Ignite DMG.
### Valks with Bleed DMG - [Peregrine Sword](/valk/ps): Deals Physical DMG, and most of her attacks also count as Bleed DMG. - [Cosmic Expression](/valk/ce): Deals Physical DMG, and most of her attacks also count as Bleed DMG. - [Lunar Vow](/valk/lv): Deals Lightning DMG, and most of her attacks also count as Bleed DMG. - [Valkyrie Quicksand](/valk/vq): Deals Physical DMG, and all of her attacks also count as Bleed DMG. ### Valks with Ignite DMG - [Miracle Magical Girl](/valk/sirin): Deals Fire DMG, and most of her attacks also count as Ignite DMG. ### Bleed / Ignite DMG vs DoT Although they are not entirely the same, Bleed and Ignite DMG do inherit some properties from Bleed and Ignite status damage-over-time (DoT). For example: - Bleed DoT does not crit. Valkyrie Quicksand and Cosmic Expression attacks that deal Bleed DMG also cannot crit. - Bleed / Ignite DoT are not considered as Melee or Ranged DMG. Bleed / Ignite DMG are also not considered as Melee / Ranged DMG. - If an equipment buffs Bleed / Ignite DMG, it affects both the valk's Bleed / Ignite DoT and Bleed / Ignite DMG. In addition, valkyries that deal Bleed / Ignite DMG has buffs that are related to the Bleed / Ignite status DoT. For example: - Miracle Magical Girl's Ultimate count as Ignite DMG, and the damage increases for each Ignite DoT stack that the enemy has. --- ## HP Loss DMG HP Loss DMG is a special dmg that only a few valkyries have. It deals a fixed damage and the damage value is equal to a percentage of another damage. Basically like True DMG in Star Rail.
Examples of HP Loss DMG - Herrscher of Finality: During Stellar Outburst, each Basic ATK deals additional HP Loss DMG, equal to 120% of the Basic ATK's damage. - Reign Solaris: Against IMG enemies, a portion of damage dealt to IMG shell will be dealt to IMG seed. This damage is HP Loss DMG. Some enemies require HP Loss DMG to counter their mechanics. For example, Twin Wardens. --- ## Stardust DMG This is a special dmg that can only be done against Stardust (SD) enemies. The more SD remnant stacks you have, the more damage you deal to the enemy's Max HP.

Game Mechanics.title: Damage Calculation
Game Mechanics.rawContent:
## Damage Multiplier Valkyries, weapon, stigma, etc provide **buffs**, also known as **damage multipliers**: - Total DMG (TDM) - TDM Taken - Elemental DMG - Elemental DMG Taken - Lightning DMG - Lightning DMG Taken - Ice DMG - Ice DMG Taken - Fire DMG - Fire DMG Taken - Physical DMG - Physical DMG Taken - Crit DMG - Bleed DMG - Bleed DMG Taken - Ignite DMG - Ignite DMG Taken --- ## Damage Element and Multipliers Relationship As we have learnt in damage type lesson, most damage in the game belong to one of these damage elements: - Physical DMG, Lightning DMG, Ice DMG, Fire DMG - +Special (Bleed DMG, Ignite DMG) Each dmg element can be affected by the following dmg multipliers:
Lightning / Ice / Fire DMG Physical DMG Bleed / Ignite DMG
Lightning / Ice / Fire DMG buff Physical DMG buff Bleed / Ignite DMG Buff
Elemental DMG buff Total DMG buff Total DMG buff
Total DMG buff Crit DMG
--- ## Damage Calculation ### Base DMG Let's take Herrscher of Finality's (HoFi) Ultimate skill as an example.
HoFi's ult deals 3300% ATK of Fire DMG, and let's say HoFi has 1435 ATK stat.
The base dmg of HoFi's ult before dmg calculation is 3300% x 1435 = **47,355 Fire DMG.** ### Addition and multiplication of dmg multipliers - Same damage multipliers are added up. - Different damage multiplier are multiplied. Let's say Support Valk gives: | Total DMG | TDM Taken | Fire DMG | Fire DMG Taken | |--|--|--|--| | +20% | +40% | +10% | +35% | Then the support's equipment gives: | Total DMG | TDM Taken | Fire DMG | Fire DMG Taken | |--|--|--|--| | +10% | +25% | +105% | +31% | Firstly, we **add up** the same buff types - Total DMG = 20% + 10% = 30% (convert to decimal => 1.3) - TDM Taken = 40% + 25% = 65% (convert to decimal => 1.65) - Fire DMG = 10% + 105% = 115% (convert to decimal => 2.15) - Fire DMG Taken = 35% + 31% = 66% (convert to decimal => 1.66) Next, we **multiply** the different dmg buffs to get the final dmg multiplier provided by the support
= 1.3 x 1.65 x 2.15 x 1.66
= 7.66x DMG multiplier ### Final DMG In real situations, there are other buffs and stats like Elemental Breach, weather effect, enemy's DEF, resistance, etc, but for this lesson, let's say there is no other buff, and the boss has no resistance. The final damage of HoFi's Ult will be: = Base DMG x DMG Multiplier
= 47,355 x 7.66

= 362, 739.3 Fire DMG

--- ## Independent DMG Multipliers Some effects provide normal buffs like Total DMG, Physical DMG, etc but during dmg calculation, they **are multiplied** instead of added up with dmg multipliers with the same name. These buffs are called **independent damage multipliers.** These are usually very strong dmg buffs since they are multiplicative. 1. In valkyrie and equipment skill descriptions, if an effect has **(independent)** text, that is an independent dmg multiplier. A valk usually has at least one 'independent' clause in her kit, signature weapon and signature stigma. 2. Part 2 weapon synergy always have one independent dmg multiplier that affects the team and the valk herself. 3. Abyss weather effect is an independent dmg multiplier. This is why a lineup that matches / activates the weather effect is better than the ones that don't. 4. A skill that includes **takes more dmg from the host / wielder** is an independent dmg multiplier.This was tested with Thales M stigma. It was such a long time ago, I am not sure if this is still true now. But it doesn't really matter. These numbers are just gibberish for most players. Nowadays, every valk has all dmg buffs, but have more restricted activation requirement. And valks just use their signature weapon and stigma, and stigma is farmable now.

Game Mechanics.title: Impair and Physical Breach
Game Mechanics.rawContent:
## What is Impair? Enemies have DEF stat, which affects their resistance to Physical DMG. **Impair** reduces the DEF stat by a percentage.
--- ## How to Impair? ### Part 1 In Part 1, only a few valkyries / equipment can provide impair. These were very valuable supports for Physical teams. - Herrscher of Rebirth, Herrscher of Sentience, Celestial Hymn ( DEF -75% ) - Terminal Aide ( DEF -70%, 5 seconds only ) - Divine Prayer ( DEF -80%, random target ) - Weapons: Briareus EX, Twins of Eden ( DEF -65% ) and more. ### Part 2 In Part 2, so far, all Physical valkyries have their own impair. --- ## Impair Effect Behavior ### Two impairs do not stack **IMPAIRS DO NOT STACK**. The latest impair will override the previous impair. ### Impair Aura Herrscher of Rebirth (HoRB) and Herrscher of Sentience (HoS) impair is like an aura - the impair effect is constantly reapplied every tick on all enemies on the field. For example, if you use Celestial Hymn (CH) impair during HoS impair duration, CH impair will only apply for a split second before HoS impair is reapplied. --- ## What is Physical Breach? Physical Breach is basically impair, but **Physical Breach can stack with impair**! Physical Breach was first introduced in version 5.0 for Elysian Realm mode. Since it is a solo mode and most Part 1 Physical DPS cannot apply their own impair, Physical Breach is added as an alternative to impair. In version 7.6, Serapeum AstralOp has Physical Breach for her assist skill. ### Physical Breach State In version 7.8, Vita [Lone Planetfarer](/valk/lp) is officially the first valkyrie that can provide Physical Breach for other characters. (Physical Breach +37% (S) / 45% (S1)). The Physical Breach is provided through a buff called Physical Breach state. ### Does Physical Breach stack with other Physical Breach 1. Physical Breach stacks with other Physical Breach multiplicatively. 2. Multiple Physical Breach **states** do not stack. You can only have one Physical Breach state. The latest Physical Breach state overrides the previous Physical Breach state. The only exception is with Vita Lone Planetfarer - Vita does not override the previous Physical Breach state, and converts her own Breach state into Physical DMG buff at a certain rate. --- ## Impair + Phy Breach Calculation I am not gonna lie, the source for DEF and impair calculation is a very old CN post, and I am not sure if it's still true today. So here is something from a recent post that has a very simple calculation for Impair + Breach Basically, Impair stacks with Phy Breach **multiplicatively**. - Jovial Deception's impair: DEF -55% => 1-0.55 = 0.45 - Vita's Phy Breach (S-rank): +37% (which is equal to DEF -37%) => 1-0.37 = 0.63 - Impair = 1 - ( 0.45 x 0.63 ) = 0.7165

Final Impair = 71.65%

Game Mechanics.title: Elemental Breach
Game Mechanics.rawContent:
## What is Elemental Breach? Enemies have Elemental Resistance stat. **Elemental Breach** makes your attack ignores a portion of the Elemental Resistance stat of an enemy. It's a very powerful buff. It's basically like PEN RES from Star Rail. ## Elemental Breach State Ele Breach is very common in S-rank Valkyries. But only a few S-rank can give Elemental Breach for other valkyries through a buff called **Elemental Breach state.** ### Part 1 Valkyries 1. Azure Empyrea
The first valk to provide Elemental Breach state. She's just and fair, she gives Elemental Breach for all valks, no questions asked. 2. Jade Knight
Provides Elemental Breach state only for Ice valkyries. 3. Herrscher of Truth
Provides Elemental Breach state only for Fire and Lightning valkyries. 4. Lunar Vow
Provides Elemental Breach state only for Lightning valkyries. ### Part 2 Valkyries 1. Senadina
Provides Elemental Breach state for World Star and Wheel of Destiny characters. 2. Schicksal's Imperative
Provides Elemental Breach state only for Theresa characters when AR is not activated. 3. Vita Lone Planetfarer
Provides Elemental Breach state when Astral Ring is activated. When WS / WoD / LoA is activated, the Elemental Breach state is only applied for valks with the same AR. ## Does Elemental Breach stack? 1. Elemental Breach stacks with other Elemental Breach multiplicatively. 2. Multiple Elemental Breach **states** do not stack. You can only have one Elemental Breach state. The latest Ele Breach state overrides the previous Ele Breach state. The only exception is with Vita Lone Planetfarer - Vita does not override the previous Ele Breach state, and converts her own Breach state into Elemental DMG buff at a certain rate. ## Translation Error ðŸ¤” "Wait, there's no mention of Ele Breach state anywhere in anyone's skill description?" You're right. That's because **it's missing in english translations**. Hoyoverse is a small indie company, please understand.
The only character that has 'Ele Breach state' properly mentioned in skill description is Vita Lone Planetfarer. You can refer to the list above to see which characters give Ele Breach state (generally if the valk gives Breach to other valks, it's Ele Breach state.) Additionally, in Elysian Realm, Azure Empyrea, Senadina, and Thelema supports all are missing the 'Ele Breach state' clause in their skill description.

Game Mechanics.title: Time Stop
Game Mechanics.rawContent:
## What is Time Stop? Time Stop, or officially known as Time Frozen Domain (no one actually uses this term) is a feature that certain S-rank valkyries have. One or more of their abilities can **pause stage timer and buff timer** during its animation OR for a certain duration.
Image above shows before and after Reign Solaris ultimate skill, which has time stop. The bonus point timer remains the same, while the boss hp goes from x4 bar to bye bye bar. ## Why is it so good? ### Score Exalted Abyss is the most important end-game mode in Honkai Impact. Abyss uses a timer score system. Time stop = higher score. This also applies to other modes like Elysian Realm and Memorial Arena. ### Buff Duration Makes you not lose support buff duration while the valk is doing her super cool animation for 10 seconds. ## Fun Fact The reason why no one uses Time Frozen Domain term is because time stop existed since v4.6 (2021), but the Time Frozen Domain term was only added in 6.4 (2023), I might be wrong on the exact patch but it came really late and everyone was already used to calling it time stop. More trivia on Time Stop: - The first valkyrie to have Time Stop is Herrscher of Sentience in version 4.6. Her Ultimate animation has Time Stop. - The first valkyrie to have two Ultimates with Time Stop is Herrscher of Thunder with her Divine Key - Seven Thunders of Retribution. - The first valkyrie to have a skill with Time Stop that is not an Ultimate is Bright Knight with Divine Key - Abyss Flower. - The first valkyrie to have a timestop duration that allows you to attack freely is Herrscher of Finality. - The first valkyries to have buffs / skills activation that require timestop are Herrscher of Origin and Finality.

Game Mechanics.title: How to Get More DMG
Game Mechanics.rawContent:
Time Stop, or officially known as Time Frozen Domain (no one actually uses this term) is a feature that certain S-rank valkyries have. One or more of their abilities can **pause stage timer and buff timer** during its animation OR for a certain duration.


## Why is it so good?

### Score
Exalted Abyss is the most important end-game mode in Honkai Impact. Abyss uses a timer score system. Time stop = higher score. This also applies to other modes like Elysian Realm and Memorial Arena.

### Buff Duration
Makes you not lose support buff duration while the valk is doing her super cool animation for 10 seconds.

## Fun Fact
The reason why no one uses Time Frozen Domain term is because time stop existed since v4.6 (2021), but the Time Frozen Domain term was only added in 6.4 (2023), I might be wrong on the exact patch but it came really late and everyone was already used to calling it time stop.

More trivia on Time Stop:
- The first valkyrie to have Time Stop is Herrscher of Sentience in version 4.6. Her Ultimate animation has Time Stop.
- The first valkyrie to have two Ultimates with Time Stop is Herrscher of Thunder with her Divine Key - Seven Thunders of Retribution.
- The first valkyrie to have a skill with Time Stop that is not an Ultimate is Bright Knight with Divine Key - Abyss Flower.
- The first valkyrie to have a timestop duration that allows you to attack freely is Herrscher of Finality.
- The first valkyries to have buffs / skills activation that require timestop are Herrscher of Origin and Finality.
